abstract: United Nations warns rising violence in Central African Republic has driven almost 70,000 people from their homes and increasingly destabilized country ahead of Pope Francis' visit.
lead_paragraph: The United Nations warned that a resurgence of violence has driven tens of thousands of people from their homes and threatens humanitarian aid.

headline.main: As Pope Francis’ Visit Nears, Central African Republic Violence Rises
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Africa; Central African Republic: Violence Is Rising, U.N. Agency Warns

snippet: The United Nations warned that a resurgence of violence has driven tens of thousands of people from their homes and threatens humanitarian aid.
